derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as a verb): perhaps related to Old Norse skorpna 'be shrivelled'

entry.def: To scorch something means to burn it slightly.

example.ex: The bomb scorched the side of the building.
example.tran: 炸弹烧焦了建筑物的一侧。

entry.tran: (因过热或化学品的作用)(使)变色,(使)留有标记
entry.def: If something scorches or is scorched, it becomes marked or changes colour because it is affected by too much heat or by a chemical.

example.ex: The leaves are inclined to scorch in hot sunshine...
example.tran: 叶子在酷热的阳光下容易枯黄。

example.ex: If any of the spray goes onto the lawn it will scorch the grass.
example.tran: 这种喷雾剂向草坪上轻轻一喷，就会使草枯黄。

entry.def: If you scorch round a place, you move round it very quickly, either in a car or on foot.

example.ex: Many people dream of scorching round a racetrack.
example.tran: 许多人梦想能绕着跑道飞奔。

means.word_mean: 2. a plant disease that produces a browning or scorched appearance of plant tissues

sentences.sentence: "my eyebrows singed when I bent over the flames"

means.word_mean: 3. destroy completely by or as if by fire;

sentences.sentence: "The wildfire scorched the forest and several homes"

means.word_mean: 4. burn slightly and superficially so as to affect color;

sentences.sentence: "The fire charred the ceiling above the mantelpiece"

means.word_mean: 5. become scorched or singed under intense heat or dry conditions;

sentences.sentence: "The exposed tree scorched in the hot sun"

The hot weather scorched the grass.
